description: From Medieval Latin acuātus, past participle of acuāre, variant of Classical Latin acuere, present active infinitive of acuō (“I sharpen”), from acus (“needle”).

adjectives.description: acuate (comparative more acuate, superlative most acuate)

verbs.description: acuate (third-person singular simple present acuates, present participle acuating, simple past and past participle acuated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To sharpen; to make pungent; to quicken.
examples: wicked dispositions shou'd have knowledge to acuate their ill intentions
